content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Fairbanks Field Office, Fisheries and Habitat Restoration</origin> <pubdate>20130201</pubdate> <title>AquaBase, Fish Species Attributes. FWS (2012)</title> <edition Sync="TRUE">2012</edition> <geoform Sync="TRUE">tabular digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Fairbanks, AK</pubplace> <publish>Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://arcticlcc.org/products/spatial-data/show/aquabase-geodatabase</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This table contains information related to fish species and is one component of AquaBase.</abstract> <purpose>AquaBase is a geodatabase that links freshwater fish and hydrological information with referenced waterbody locations. Presently, the geospatial region covered is Alaska\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds central and eastern North Slope, between the Kuparuk River (west) and USA/Canada border (east).  Waterbodies include freshwater lakes, rivers, and springs. Each waterbody relates to a series of standalone database tables containing detailed fisheries life history and hydrological data, and full references to scientific publications.</purpose> <supplinf>AquaBase is being developed to compile the plethora of aquatic literature on the North Slope in a useful, concise form so land managers, biologists, and project planners can access all the pertinent data relating to their individual needs.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>unknown</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Irregular</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-150.8</westbc> <eastbc>-140.1</eastbc> <northbc>70.6</northbc> <southbc>67.7</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>biota</themekey> <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>User</themekt> <themekey>fish</themekey> <themekey>water</themekey> <themekey>river</themekey> <themekey>lake</themekey> <themekey>spring</themekey> <themekey>fish distribution</themekey> <themekey>fish species</themekey> <themekey>fish life history</themekey> <themekey>hydrological data</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Alaska</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None.  It is highly recommended that users download the dataset directly from the originator.</accconst> <useconst>Neither the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service,  Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative or contributors to this dataset shall be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. In an effort to provide the most comprehensive overview possible, we have incorporated many data sources, representing many different survey methods. Inherent in any data set used to develop graphical representations, are limitations of accuracy as determined by, among others, the source, scale and resolution of the data.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Fairbanks Fish and Wildlife Field Office</cntorg> <cntper>Jeff Adams</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Branch Chief, Fisheries and Habitat Restoration</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype> <address>101 12th Ave, Room 110</address> <city>Fairbanks</city> <state>Alaska</state> <postal>99701</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>907 456 0218</cntvoice> <cntemail>jeff_adams@fws.gov</cntemail> <cntinst>Contact by phone or email.</cntinst> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Fairbanks Field Office, Fisheries and Habitat Restoration and Arctic Landscape Conservation Cooperative.</datacred> <secinfo> <secsys>FIPS Pub 199</secsys> <secclass>No Confidentiality</secclass> <sechandl>Standard Technical Controls</sechandl> </secinfo> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>Data were collected from different sources and subsequently processed (reformatted) so that they could be aggregated and distributed.  QA/QC completed by Fisheries Biologist.</logic> <complete>Users are reminded that these data do not represent all locations within the geographic scope of this database that may be occupied by fish.  Furthermore, not all available hydrological data available for waterbodies within the geographic scope of the database are incorporated into this dataset.</complete> <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc>Data were collected from different sources and subsequently processed (reformatted) so that they could be aggregated and distributed.
